channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Planarity of compactifications of $\mathbb{R}$ with arc-like remainder
item.description: arXiv:2409.20455v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that if $X$ is an arc-like continuum, then any continuum which is the union of $X$ and a ray $R$ such that $X \cap R = \emptyset$ and $\overline{R} \setminus R \subseteq X$ can be embedded in the plane $\mathbb{R}^2$. Further, we prove that any compactification of a line with remainder $X$ is also embeddable in $\mathbb{R}^2$ -- answering a question of Sam B. Nadler from 1972.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Ammerlaan, Logan C. Hoehn

item.title: Toroidal embeddings of cubic projective plane obstructions
item.description: arXiv:2409.19364v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Work of Glover and Huneke shows that a cubic graph embeds into the real projective plane if and only if it does not contain one of six topological minors called cubic projective plane obstructions. Here we classify up to equivalence the embeddings of these graphs into the torus.
item.dc:creator: Marie Kramer

item.title: Omission of Intervals: Deducing covering properties of subsets of the real line from their combinatorial structure
item.description: arXiv:2409.20518v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We develop a method that we call \emph{omission of intervals}, for establishing topological properties of subsets of the real line based on their combinatorial structure. Using this method, we obtain conceptual proofs of the fundamental theorems in this realm, and new results that were hitherto inaccessible.
item.dc:creator: Boaz Tsaban

item.title: Semi-coarse Spaces, Homotopy and Homology
item.description: arXiv:2210.02569v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We begin the study the algebraic topology of semi-coarse spaces, which are generalizations of coarse spaces that enable one to endow non-trivial `coarse-like' structures to compact metric spaces, something which is impossible in coarse geometry. We first study homotopy in this context, and we then construct homology groups which are invariant under semi-coarse homotopy equivalence. We further show that any undirected graph $G=(V,E)$ induces a semi-coarse structure on its set of vertices $V_G$, and that the respective semi-coarse homology is isomorphic to the Vietoris-Rips homology. This, in turn, leads to a homotopy invariance theorem for the Vietoris-Rips homology of undirected graphs.
item.dc:creator: Antonio Rieser, Jonathan Trevi\~no-Marroqu\'in
